comments:
3.0RC2 (Build id: 200406111814)
To duplicate, check out the org.eclipse.ui.tutorials.rcp.part1 project from 
CVS. Create a new Debug launch configuration for it. Set the application name 
to org.eclipse.ui.tutorials.rcp.part1.RcpApplication . Add the -consoleLog 
option. In the Configurations tab turn off Use the the default list. Turn on 
Clean the configuration area before launching. Delete the entry for 
org.eclipse.update.configurator. In the Plug-ins tab select Choose plug-ins 
and fragments to launch from the list. Click Deselect All. Put a check next to 
org.eclipse.ui.tutorials.rcp.part1. Click Add Required Plug-ins. Click Debug 
to launch the program. 

The following errors will be sent to the console window and a strange looking 
workbench window will come up. In bug 66726, Wassimm says this should work. If 
you change nothing else but turn back on the option to Use the default list in 
the Configurations tab it will work perfectly. The browser example works fine 
too, either way.

although not technically a dup of bug 66726, the fix and cleanup for bug 66726 
also addressed this bug as well.

The problem here was that your tutorials, unlike the rcp examples, do require 
update.configurator.  Even when update.configurator was removed from the 
autostart list, just by its virtue of being in the list of plugins to launch, 
it gets started by the runtime.  
Because said plugin was not among the autostart, PDE was not generating a 
platform.xml for it, so Update started doing its own thing upon startup and 
generating its own platform.xml causing all those problems.

This is all fixed up now.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 66726 ***
